activities:
Orbitz Worldwide (“OWW”) is a leading global online travel company that uses innovative technology to enable leisure and business travelers to search for and book a broad range of travel products and services from suppliers worldwide, including air travel, hotels, vacation packages, car rentals, cruises, travel insurance and destination services such as ground transportation, event tickets and tours. 
OWW and its subsidiaries obtain personal information from leisure and business consumers through their websites, mobile applications and telephone, or through e-mail communications, interviews, surveys, contests, promotions, raffles or sweepstakes.  OWW and its subsidiaries use personal information received from customers in EU/EEA and/or Switzerland in order to provide and enhance the products or services offered on OWW and its subsidiaries’ websites; to record customers’ travel preferences, to make reservations or acquire travel insurance on behalf of customers, or to communicate with customers about their travel plans; to issue invoices, administer accounts, and collect and process payments; to provide tips or guidance on how to use the websites, inform customers of new features on the websites or provide other information that may be of interest to users; to personalize the service OWW and its subsidiaries provide to customers, tailor customers’ experiences at the websites or other sites to their interests and make more appropriate travel recommendations; to send customers commercial communications, if the customer has not opted-out of receiving these communications; to manage the websites, diagnose technical problems, improve content and allocate the resources of OWW’s systems so that customers’ experiences with the websites are as efficient as possible; to process and track customers transactions and to send customers information about OWW’s and its affiliates' and business partners' products and services and other information and materials that may be of interest to customers; to develop, enhance, market, sell or provide OWW’s products or services, or those of companies with which OWW has a commercial relationship, but only if a customer has granted permission to do so or OWW is otherwise able to do so under applicable law; to evaluate credit standing and to match credit bureau or credit reporting agency information; to investigate, detect and protect OWW and other third parties against error, negligence, breach of contract, fraud, theft and other illegal activities; to effect a corporate transaction in connection with the sale, merger, spin-off or other corporate reorganization, where the information is provided to the new controlling entity in regular course of business; to audit compliance with OWW’s policies and contractual obligations; as permitted by, and to comply with, any legal or regulatory requirements or provisions; or for any other purpose to which a customer consents.
corpofftitle1: Assistant General Counsel - Litigation and Compliance
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
